newsitem.title: INDIA: Delhi shares end lower after early gains.
newsitem.headline: Delhi shares end lower after early gains.

text.p: Delhi shares shed early gains to close lower on Thursday as late selling by profit-takers outweighed fresh buying by foreign institutional investors, brokers said.
The Delhi sensitive index fell 3.71 points to close at 792.03.
"Shares failed to sustain higher levels as profit-takers preferred to book profits at every rise which mainly disrupted the recovery," said Yogesh sethi of brokers Vinayaka Investments.
Reliance Industries fell 4.35 to 209.90 while TISCO lost 1.75 rupees to close at 188.35. State Bank of India dropped 5.20 rupees to 207.20 mainly on selling by mutual funds.
ACC lost 55 rupees at 2,085 while TELCO gained four rupees to close at 484.
